Reviews.Title: “A very nice, very new hotel”
Reviews.Author: OLTamina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a group tour of England. We stayed there for several days. and also stayed in a couple of other hotels. I should say right away this one was the best of the three. Positive: 1. It is very new 2. Normal-size rooms (which is really unusual for London). 3. Breakfast bar is very good (rolls (croissants), jams, cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, hot tea, coffee,...) and is very filling. Also you can upgrade breakfast for a bit of money to include sausage links and other hot dishes. But after eating the upgraded version the first morning I realized that I could not eat that much again! But it was delicious either way. 4. Located not far from underground 5. Located next door to the biggest mall in Europe - Westfield mall. It is a brand new mall and it is huge! It has an outstanding food court with some ethnic cafes and has a grocery store or two as well as all kinds of department stores. 6. The staff is very friendly 7. Clean 8. ATM in the lobby 9. Wi-fi connection (though some folks had troubel with it) and you can buy time on the computer in the lobby. 10. The neighborhood felt safe. 11. The Olympic stadium and the abstract Olympic statue is nearby. Negative: Some students in our group had to share a bed and said that the bed was slanted towards the middle. But I was in a single room and loved my room very much. I do not know how expensive it was since it was part of the tour.

Reviews.Title: “still good”
Reviews.Author: edhuwjim
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel back in October and not much has changed. There is still the problem with parking charges (not PI's fault, I guess), but you can make it cheaper if you're prepared to move your car regularly. You just drive out and turn back into the same car park. The point here being that the first two hours are free and it's only £2 for after 6pm to before 8 am. If you just leave your car sat there for 24 hrs+ you'll get stung for an eye-watering £26. Ouch. Still the problem with room temp. being too hot in our opinion. Can't open the windows and the air con was a bit feeble. Kids had problem getting off to sleep, as did my wife. Best views from odd number rooms on higher floors, but the other side is nice too. Don't expect to be given close-together rooms just because you might have booked 2 at the same time, in the same name. Shopping is great, breakfast even better. High quality ingredients, well cooked. Can't imagine there's a better deal in the UK when you have 2 kids free per adult...i.e. £7 something for 3 magnificent breakfasts. Sorry, just drooled on keyboard. We saved a bit by eating marked-down Waitrose sandwhiches on the Sunday night. 45p for chicken and bacon!! Become available at about 4.30 onwards!! Quality of the rooms and interior in general still very high.. more 5* than 'budget'. Staff really nice. We got it at £39 per room which is very good value indeed. We'll be back when there's a nice offer again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from a Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: higginsn
Reviews.Content: Nice and new, great location, everything you expect from a premier Inn. Fantastic views of the Olympic Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely impressed!”
Reviews.Author: SarahGibson
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed for 6 nights and we really could not have been happier with our choice of hotel. I had a family room on the 10th floor with amazing views of the Olympic Park & other landmarks, and my Mum had a double room, also on the 10th floor, all very new and perfect. My bathroom was a decent size, with bath & shower, plenty of shelf space & sparkling clean. As promised, the bed was really comfortable, and extra pillows were provided. The heating/air conditioning system was excellent, probably the best I have ever encountered in a hotel. I appreciated having the means to make a cup of tea, and I was able to ask for an iron and board to be delivered to my room. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning - if you have not already pre-booked it, you can just pay for it on the day. The full cooked breakfast was excellent - they will cook eggs, porridge or veggie sausages to order (I had poached eggs on toast) and you help yourself to everything else, as much as you want! After a few days we switched to the continental breakfast - loads of different cereals which you can customise with dried fruits/seeds, plus croissants, crumpets, toast, muffins, fresh fruit & yoghurts. My Mum reported that the coffee was very good! One night we went for the hotel's Meal Deal - a 3 course meal with wine AND a full breakfast the next morning for £22 which was great value (I had the rump steak, cooked to medium-rare perfection!). I loved the location - attached to a great shopping centre (Waitrose & loads of lovely food stalls right next door for those in-room munchies!), directly opposite Stratford International station and a 5 minute walk through the centre to Stratford tube for the Central Line and Overground trains. But best of all, I loved the staff - they were all charming and helpful, and obviously took pride in giving great customer service. A real credit to their employers. This was actually the first time I have ever stayed in a Premier Inn, but, if this experience is anything to go by, it certainly won't be the last. A huge thank you for such an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “would absolutely visit again”
Reviews.Author: charli_bubble
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you could ask for. the rooms were a good size, incredibly clean, the security was fantastic, the staff were superb and the location was great! the meal deal was a fantastic idea, we ate a wonderful 3 course meal and the buffet breakfast was delicious and fresh. even if you didnt take the high speed train line it was only 20mins by tube into the centre of London

Reviews.Title: “Will definately go back ...”
Reviews.Author: morsupple
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with breakfast as we arrived early & this was a great start as breakfast is 'All you can eat' which was lovely & Deborah was really welcoming. Sue the receptionist was really friendly too. The hotel will hold bags in a holding room so not to be carrying them around. Our room was lovely, clean & bed/pillows very comfortable. Staff are lovely & friendly.The hotel is right next to Westfield shopping centre & train/tube station is less than 5mins away. The only problem is trying to find it but one goes through Westfield shopping centre which is up the steps from street & after that security are helpful in giving directions. Will definately be back to stay there again & would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon P
Reviews.Content: really good hotel situated over the westfield shopping centre (great shops) the hotel is really nice with clean comfortable rooms and a really nice restaurant excellant views from our room of the olympic park and also when it goes dark the london skyline, stratford international station is right outside the hotel door where you can catch the DLR and head straight into london the only downside to this hotel is the car park is so expensive because you have to use the shopping centre car park which is such a shame because its a great hotel otherwise i give it 10/10

Reviews.Title: “First stay at a Premier Inn..”
Reviews.Author: flockedwallpaper
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Premier Inn, and it definitely won't be my last. We stayed for 3 nights in a very clean & comfortable room on the 5th floor. We usually stay at a Holiday Inn, but found Premier Inn to be cheaper this time & I wouldn't hesitate in choosing this location again. It's just above the Westfield Shopping Centre which is great for shopping & amazing for places to eat if you don't want to use the Restaurant in the hotel (we chose not to because there weren't too many vegetarian options) However we did eat breakfast there on the first morning. At £7.99 each, I thought the breakfast was quite pricey, but it was worth the money as it was all fresh, hot & plentiful (all you can eat!) I appreciated the veggie sausage option for the cooked breakfasts too, as this isn't something you see very often in chain hotels. I also liked that you could order pizza & drinks from the restaurant to eat in your room! All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, without being intrusive. Oh, and the free 30 minutes Wifi (each day) was very welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: felstedmummy
Reviews.Content: New hotel so everything was clean and new. Excellent for shopping at Westfields, also as a base for a few days in London. Meals at dinner are enormous!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: mipita
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel, on a lovely room on the sixth floor, overlooking the Olympic Park. The room was quiet, spotlessly clean, with a great bed, extra pillows and stable, comfortable temperature. It is very conveniently located: practically in Westfield Shopping Centre, but isolated from all its hustle and bustle. We were able to shop early on Sat morning when there were very few customers around. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, although we did drop by and it looked quite inviting. The hotel is a bit hard to find, but if one follows the directions on the web page, it is quite easy. However, I totally agree with sp08cm who recommended "travelling one extra stop on the DLR from Stratford Station the first time to find where it is and then work out the quickest way through the Westfield shopping centre afterwards".

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: roperhereford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on march the 9th 2012 my daughter had won some tickets for british olympic swimming trails .We found the check in quick .We were offered the meal deal which we took up just a little warning we were not told that when you go in for your eve meal you must say i have the ultiment meal deal and i have paid for it as we found out that because we did not say we had paid for it they were going to try and charge us another 44 pounds because of how they entered it in the till after some disscusion the young lady admitted it was her mistake but it was a shame as it was a bit upsetting for us having to try to confirm we had paid and not being listened to having to keep explaining to two of the ladies that we had paid still it was only a small matter really but if we had been told what to say at time of booking and paying it would have helped and maybe wth lots of international visiters for the olympics it maybe wise to start doing that. The room was fine no problems clean and a good nights sleep check out was a bit manic had to wait 15 mins to hand keys in .

Reviews.Title: “Olympic Park's closest accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyh591
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to spectate at the British Swimming Trials across the road at the aquatics centre in the Olympic Park. It's a brand new and typical Premier Inn but set in a twelve storey high building with no car parking of its own and only basic reception facilities. Our double bedroom was to the normal Premier standard and bathroom facilities and cleanliness were all tip-top. Staff in all areas of the hotel were very friendly and helpful and the all you can eat breakfast at £7.99 was a great way to start a busy couple of days. One grumble - no food whatsoever is served after 10.30 p.m., but staff did phone a local pizzeria to deliver us a pizza to eat in the still open hotel bar at 11.30p.m. Sandwiches or something similar would have been nicer though. The location of the hotel is within the Westfield shopping centre and perfect for access to the multitude of shops and restaurants here. It's also second only to the shortly to open Holiday Inn in terms of proximity to the various venues in and around the Olympic Park. As a result, prices during the Olympics are sure to be hiked to stratospheric levels though so watch out!

Reviews.Title: “Group visit for Olympic Swimming Trials”
Reviews.Author: 3nations_family
Reviews.Content: I took a group of 35 young swimmers and parents on a trip to see the Olympic trials and we stayed at the Premier Inn. Location was perfect, right next to the Stratford International station which was only 6 minutes in to St Pancras, and 5 minutes walk to the Olympic park. The rooms were obviously new, clean and comfortable, I thought the backlit mirror above the hairdryer station was a brilliant touch for what is supposed to be a budget hotel. Without exception, every member of staff we encountered over the weekend weas friendly and helpful, even when faced with a group of excited teenagers seeing their heroine Rebecca Adlington sitting next to them at breakfast. The bar and restaurant area was very modern and comfortable and again, much more than you would expect at a budget hotel. The unlimited breakfast is a great bargain, doubly so when kids eat for free- it is amazing how much 12 year olds can put away! Only one constructive criticism was that the bar was understaffed on both nights. The hotel was obviously 100% full and service was extremely slow as the bar staff were also on duty for the restaurant. We will certainly be actively looking out for Premier Inn for our next group or family break. This is a great flagship hotel for the company to show off for the Olympics.

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor restaurant...”
Reviews.Author: DevaDave27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is difficult to find but aim for the multi story car park at Stratford Shopping Mall... the hotel has great views over the city at night. next door is a great pub/micro brew selling real ales. Dinner was a complete shambles, the baked camebert only took 5 mins to serve... its supposed to take 15mins, sent it back no good heating up in a microwave! The main course was chicken Fajita, the breads were dry and cracking when trying to roll with meat. This is supposed to be the 1 of the main hotels for the Olympics area, well I wont be back unless I can find somewhere else in the shopping mall (other than the KFC and other convience) Generally the staff were couteous in reception but the restaurant was poor slow service!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Gbcradio
Reviews.Content: As frequent users of the often reliable Premier Inn hotels we felt extremely let down by the service we received at the Straford (Westfield brunch) between the 24th -26th of February 2012. On the occasion we booked a double room over two nights, the first night went failry well. The next morning we left round about 8am and clearled the room hoping that upon our return we will find a cleaned room. This was not the case when we came back for the evening at around 9 pm. The floor was clearly not hooverd and pieces of paper were evident on the dusty carpet. Glasses that we had used the previous night were still unchanged on the table where we left them. The bathroom wasalso dirty and unmoped with no evidence of any effort at cleaning whatsoever.We appreciate as Premier Inn suggests we could re-use our bed linen and towels , but the utmost disregard for even the most basic of room service was trully astounding. Because it was already late anyway when we came we did'nt bother calling reception to 'fixit' as this would have caused us unnecessary inconvience at that hour. As an asthmatic I kept sneezing all night from the clearly dusty environment I and my fiance found ourselves in. This continued right to the next morning when we finally checked out. To compound our already nasty experience , when we reported our concerns to the lady at reception (Lucie) she seemed clearly unbortherd and dimissive and seemed less intertested in hearing what we had to say showing an atitude similar to the one conveyed by her colleague (a bearded gentleman who walked away from the post and clearly disinterested in what we were sayingto his colleage when my fiance was still talking). The behaviour of the two made us feel unvalued and falls below the high standardswe have experienced in other Premier Inns in the past.With the Olympics coming to the East end I hope such shoddy service and customer service will be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: 1609MikeM51
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight in double room for Olympic Test Event. Arrived at Stratford station and staff were able to point me effortlessly in the right direction. Couldn't be zapped through quickly; problem with the credit card (which could have been my fault!) but staff were effortlessly courteous and I was offered a choice of rooms and floors. The room was spotless and warm enough and incredibly quiet!! Chose not to eat in the hotel but to go to the Westfields Centre and had a snack from the miriad of alternatives there. If I had realised how close it was to the Olympic Park entrance I think I would have had the 'eat as much as you like breakfast'. Will be stopping here again when in London later in the year. First time at Premier Inn; doubt it will be the last!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in a family room, whilst attending Olympic test event. New hotel spotlessly clean. Every member of staff extremely friendly and helpful. Our room wasnt quite ready when we arrived and without hesitation they immediately located another which turned out to have a brilliant view of the olympic stadium, although a lot of the rooms look out over the athletes village. A few minutes walk to the olympic park entrance and transport links for the rest of london are excellent (in our case Greenwich and British museum). Arrived by train via Highbury and Islington, no difficulties finding it but we had done homework before travelling ( if you're struggling pick up a map/ask concierge on ground floor of the shopping centre). Ate dinner and a couple of breakfasts food was fine and plenty of it. Will definately stay here again if in London

Reviews.Title: “Won't find better”
Reviews.Author: geegee1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I must say that this is without doubt the best Premier Inn we have ever stayed in. It is obviously very new and is maintained in a spotless condition. The room was clean, quiet, comfortable and contained everything we needed for a pleasant overnight stay. The hotel could not have been better placed for the Olympic Village and Shopping Centre and was very easy to find from Stratford Railway Station using the directions provided on the website. We only had one dinner and one breakfast both of which were hot, tasty and plentiful, providing good value for money. This restaurant was pleasantly designed and furnished providing a good environment for eating. I must give a special mention to the Reception and Restaurant staff who were extremely friendly, efficient and helpful. They obviously enjoyed their work and passed this enjoyment on to the customer. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel and cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jamie P
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 day 3 night stay at this hotel with my 2 small children and everything about it ,including the location is first class. I dont understand why some reviewers seem to find it so difficult to find the hotel as we emerged from the new high speed rail link from St Pancras to find the hotel directly in front of us, and when using the tube service to Stratford the hotel is a mere 3 minute walk through the new Westfield shopping centre. The high speed rail link takes 7 minutes from Kings Cross/St Pancras and for those travelling via underground it is maybe 20-25 minutes at most. We loved the location, far enough from the hustle and bustle of central london yet within a 25 minutes tube journey to all of the attactions my children wished to see, including Tussauds, the museums, London eye etc. As to the hotel itself, great restaurant,Fab Hot breakfast ,attentive and considerate staff, easy access to the shopping centre ( 50 yds ).If Travelling with fussy eaters like my children then worry not....look for Paul in the restaurant and Theresa ( the coloured lady ) at breakfast and nothing is too much trouble for them. All in................Fab....you won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fab position for Olympic Park”
Reviews.Author: Mini_Adventure2009
Reviews.Content: Right across road from Aquatic Centre, perfect for Westfield shopping, easy to get to using Central tube line. Ask for 10th floor room for best views over Olympic Park. Staff excellent, food fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Olympic Velodrome visit”
Reviews.Author: Karen F
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have stated it is a difficult hotel to find, but we headed towards Waitrose and asked a security guard who pointed us in the right direction. We booked this hotel because of its location to the Olympic park and it could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful! !”
Reviews.Author: wolstonlot3640
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights at this brand new premier inn, everything was first class, the staff were more than friendly and the restaurant was an added bonus after a hectic day in london.the only down side was the journey by tube to the hotel was a nightmare! i have never been on a more crowded tube, goodness knows what it will be like when the olympics are on.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Southend on Sea England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, horrible restaurant service”
Reviews.Author: Danny563
Reviews.Content: Went there two nights ago, reception staff was very helpful! The room was absolutely spotless and the view from my room was amazing, overlooking the shopping center, the Olympic park and u can also see the whole of London, absolutely wonderful. Now bad thing about this hotel: Went for dinner around 8pm and I had to wait for the waitress for about 10 min to sort out her recipes before she even talks to me. Finally i got seated next to the kitchen and I had to wait another 10 min before somebody even comes and hands in a menu. Drinks took ages to to come although 3 restaurant staff were polishing knifes and only one was serving customers. Drinks finally came and starters took another 20 min to arrive. I tried to talk to somebody about the delay of service but nobody would even listen so they kept on telling me your food will be with you shortly. For main course I had a mixed grill and went for the option of getting large chips for the price of 95p more and requested not to have grilled tomatoes and pees and have more mushrooms instead. When the order came 15 min later the meal came as standard, no large chips with pees and grilled tomatoes. I asked them why r they serving me this and the waitress said that there is probably a misunderstanding in the kitchen a she took my plate away and I had to wait another 10 min to get it back. Meanwhile I also ordered another glass of wine and it came when I was just about to finish my mixed grill. While all that chaos was happening around there was a waitress which was not even thought to walk properly as she was walking to the kitchen every time I was having the feeling that there is an earthquake. Ordered the desert and it came fairly quick (bout 5 min) and this time was the right thing. When I requested the bill I had to wait for about 10 min and when it arrived it was wrong, they tried to charge me for 3 glasses of wine rather than two and for two LARGE mixed grills. This is when I wanted to talk to a manager about the service but there was none around so they corrected my bill and I went to my room. If this place improves its restaurant customer service it would be wonderful place to stay and for sure I will be willing to go back as the location is perfect and the views from the rooms are simply amazing

Reviews.Title: “UCI World Cycling Championships”
Reviews.Author: wwm2310
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated very close to the Olympic Park and by the Westfield shopping centre. We did have a problem finding the hotel but when you find Waitrose turn right and then left and you cant miss it. If you are arriving at Stratford the international train station is the closest. Hotel was very quiet and breakfast was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Premier Inn Stratford, London”
Reviews.Author: Thenails
Reviews.Content: This is a new Premier Inn. The location is an excellent based for discovering London, Situated adjacent to the Massive Westfield Stratford Shopping Centre with possibly the best shopping in the UK, A multiplex cinema, Pubs, loads of good chain restaurants & fast food outlets of an amazing variety. A short walk through the shopping centre takes you to the Stratford station with Tube, Overland,Mainline trains & the Docklands Light Railway all merging into one brand new station. Yet the hotel was so quiet. Spotlessly clean. Parking is at the Westfield Stratford shopping centre, It cost me just over £50 for parking Sat, Sun, Mon & most of Tuesday in a very secure park. Checking in is on the first floor so you enter the hotel & get the lift up one floor. I did find that one evening I entered the Hotel & around 8 men where what looked like they were loitering which made me a tad uneasy though nothing at all happened. I would reccomend the pub on Westfield, The Cow very upmarket pub food. Jamies Italian was also good. Too many to try them all. Overall this is a very good place to stay. Outside of London right in the Olympic development area which is impressive. The staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jules43
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a three night stay here. As there was myself, my husband and my 15 year old son, this represented great value. Many London hotels are only for two or kids are classed as under 12. We arrived at Liverpool Street Station so great to jump on the Central line straight to Stratford. We got to Stratford just before 10pm so shops were shut, therefore it was easy to get through mall with luggage. As other reviewers have said it is a decent walk but that was ok for us. Also, as others had said it was hard to find I rang the hotel the day before to let them know we would be a late check-in and get directions. I was told the entrance was on the ground floor-it is in fact on the lower ground floor but this is the level you enter the mall on from the tube. It is past Waitrose and follow signs for car park A. Turn right instead of entering car park and go around the corner to entrance.Do use the lift between the entrance and reception as it is 25 metres up with over a hundred stairs.Couldn't use self-serve check-in but was checked in really quickly at desk. Room was on fourth floor-all brand spanking new and this made the price we paid even better value-there was a bath instead of just a shower which was lovely to be able to have a soak after lots of walking. There was a soap dispenser for the sink and body wash for the bath, both of which were well-known and popular brands. We had taken our own toiletries as I didn't expect there to be any, but used these too. We went straight down to bar as food was served until 10.30pm. Bar food prices were reasonable- about six pounds for paninis and baguettes, add a bowl of chips for 1.50. Food was fresh, hot and tasty. Had ice and water from the bar to take to our room. Key card operated the lift from Reception to rooms which made us feel safe. Rang Reception to ask for an extra mug, towels and milk-they were sent up very quickly. Only asked for one key card but needed a second one on the second night when hubby and son went to cinema-this card didn't work properly so was changed at Reception.Missed breakfast on the first morning by the time we'd had a lie-in and all had a shower. Lots of places to eat in mall, so this wasn't a problem. However, next day had breakfast in the hotel-very busy and had to queue. As breakfast was served till 11am and it was getting close to that I asked George who was on the till if we would still be able to get everything. He explained that as it was so busy the chef would keep cooking until everyone had eaten. It was difficult for the staff to keep up with replacing everything-bowls, plates, juices and cooked items but they worked really hard and some people may have got annoyed but hey it's half term weekend so it's just best to be patient and understand that the staff can only do so much. Without exception, all the staff at this hotel were pleasant, sociable and an absoulute credit to the company they work for. We are quite well-travelled both in the UK and abroad and quite honestly I cannot give enough praise both to the staff and this hotel in general. I would recommend it to others without hesitation-just remember it is not a central London location but within easy reach. The mall has everything you could need-we shopped here for clothes for our son, ate on our first morning, went to the cinema, bought drinks for our room and food for while we were on the move and our journey home from Waitrose and Greggs. Whilst there is still a lot of building work going on around the hotel we weren't disturbed by this at all. We all slept well in our comfy beds, my son even wanted to take a pillow home with him! As I have said before a couple of little hiccups but nothing that would stop me giving an excellent rating to this hotel Well done, Premier Inn Stratford!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit pricey for a Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: rain b
Reviews.Content: friendly clean hotel in a great location however thought the cost too inflated .

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte M
Reviews.Content: I recommend using premier inns. While I stayed there the staff were nothing but polite, and helpful thoughout. The rooms are fairly sized and are spottless. I couldn't ask for better service on the meals and this is coming from a vegetarian. I had an enjoyable stay and will be using premier inns in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Bother If You Dont Like A Walk”
Reviews.Author: wot_it_says_on_the_t
Reviews.Content: Well of all the times i have been to london never realised there was two stratford stations. Im not alone on that one either!!! So we obviously came into stratford on the regional line Not Stratford International which of course the later being dead opposite the entrance very handy if your coming from europe(all for 2012) So straight away not a clue as where premier inn was,asked several people noone had a clue and consideing it was on top of the building thats amazing. As we ( me and hubby) dont mind walking ok no problem but we took the inlaws and they are in there 70s and struggled with the trek from one end of the shopping centre to the other with bags. On arrival we had to check in on touch screens that were not at all sensitive and took some doing for the three rooms individually,someone did eventually did come to the rescue. We then decided to have a quick snack of nachos they took 45mins and eventually showed up burnt with grated cheese not melted. To be fair we complained and we got an apology and a refund. So we left there to contine our journey to o2 which should have been simple but of course another trek through the shopping centre to get the jubilee line,just before we left we asked how do we get back to the hotel later when westfield is closed we were assured he doors would be open. Guess what on our return following others doing the same thing back through the shopping centre yep the front doors where open but alas the end doors shut we were like a load od sheep we then turned round and tried the next floor thank god that was open otherwise would have had to go round outside of building. After finally getting to hotel a nice relaxing drink in the bar would have been great instead the very small bar area(god knows how they will cope when the games are on)was full with really rowdy groups drinking themselves stupid with shots, lovely so we were forced to retire to our room with a drink bought from the bar. Next morning breakfast was good thank god but it prepared us for the walk back through the shopping centre to stratford station. I was glad to get home for a rest really spoiled the weekend,would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: JMSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Had to leave some feedback following our stay, as the service from all of the staff we met was absolutely brilliant! Having been forced into an unplanned stay due to "adverse weather conditions" and missing the last train home, we arrived at about 2.30am, cold and wet, to be welcomed by staff who could not do enough to help us (and everybody else who was in the same boat!) laying on tea and coffee, sorting out rooms and finding us extra bedding for a family room which had to be prepared for us - all smiles, nothing too much trouble even at that time of the morning. This carried right through to later that morning - after a super breakfast, staff willingly browsing websites to check on availability of trains for us to complete our journey home. The room was clean and comfortable, and the view of a snow-covered olympic village from the 7th floor was fantastic too! Thanks to you all for making what had turned into a rough night something to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short breaks”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: The new premier Inn at Stratford is fantstic for short stays. The staff are incredibly friendly, the views of the olympic park are great and its a 3-4 min walk inside the shopping centre from the underground station. The room is very modern with freeview, flat screen Tv and other up to date accessories. I would reccomend 100% for a couple of nights break as you can go shopping at the huge centre and its on the central line into london so has great access to the major sights of London.

Reviews.Title: “ask for a top floor great value”
Reviews.Author: macymo
Reviews.Content: I love a premier inn, comfy beds, cleans lovely linen, if you ask for a top floor room odd number, you'll get a wonderfull view of the olympic stadium and village, canary wharf and london in the distance. also great for the shopping of course

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, well located”
Reviews.Author: Judy M
Reviews.Content: I needed somewhere to stay for 2 of nights whilst my flat was being refurbished - last minute - and had little prior knowledge of hotels so just looked through a few local budget ones. Chose this one based on cost, availability and location and wasn't disappointed. What you see on their site is what you get: clean, modern, warm room; easy to check in/out; friendly staff, on site restaurant and coffee chain (though I didn't use either as I ate out). As a lone female I was pleased to note their links with Suzy Lamplugh Trust and felt my safety was taken into consideration . If you don't know the area - you are right next to Europe's biggest shopping centre so will find somewhere to eat to suit your budget and can make the most of facilities like the cinema, bowling alley and.......oh yes, SHOPS!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: JEHAD E
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 9 nights. The services and welcoming were nice and warm. The location was very good just by the westfield mall. The only minor issue was with the internet services due to supplier company problems in their vouchers. In general was a good stay with good and large room.

Reviews.Title: “A little difficult to get to with bags from the Underground...”
Reviews.Author: squeege777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at a very good price after a 2 week holiday in Prague. We had two large bags each and two suitcase carry-ons as well. We took the National Express bus from the Stanstead airport which drops you off not too far from the front of the mall. What I didn't know was that it was going to be about 1/4-1/2 mile walk either through the mall or around the mall through the outside shops. I wish I had known this and I might have gotten a taxi. The entrance is in the back of the mall across from Stratford International train station. From the underground you need to walk all the way through the mall till you see Waitrose grocery store. Turn right, go out the doors, at the corner take another right and you will see the Stratford Intl station in front of you. Turn right again and you will see the bottom lobby of the Premier Inn. You have to take the elevator to the reception area. Reception was quick and painless and the people very friendly. Internet is 3 pounds a day or 10 pounds for a week's worth (you get a code on a card). You can share this card between a family or friends in the same room. Rooms are somewhat small but we had a nice view of the Olympic Stadium. Bed was super comfy. Food- We didn't eat the breakfast because 8 pounds works out to be 13 dollars a person for Americans and we didn't want to spend $26 on breakfast. McDonald's and Subway are open inside the mall for breakfast and both of us together had breakfast for 7 pounds. There are many many other restaurants in the mall during the day, I recommend "Tortilla" it is a Mexican place (Intl food court) reasonably priced that is like a "Chipotle Mexican Grill" and the Chicago Rib place had decent ribs but not with a sit-down price. Apart from the somewhat long walk (it's not too bad without suitcases) to/from the underground/metro the hotel is great. You are about 18-20 min from Oxford Circus on the Central line of the underground (9 stops)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Margumfa
Reviews.Content: Have just spent three nights at the Premier Inn London Stratford and had a great stay. Perhaps it's because it's a brand new hotel but the quality of our room was excellent and we were really excited when we looked out the window at the amazing view of the Olympic stadium, velodrome and swimming pool. Staff were excellent, by far the best service I've ever received in London. Tricia in particular was really helpful and genuinely interested in how we were enjoying our break; my husband asked for soya milk at breakfast on our first day and she remembered the next morning without being prompted. Such a small thing but it made us feel special. Like other visitors we probably would have struggled to find the hotel but there's an information point just inside the Westfields shopping centre and we simply asked there and found the hotel no problem. We came on the Circle line tube from St Pancras and had no problems getting to the hotel. We took the high speed train into London one day just to check it out but it's cheaper and more fun to catch the tube, probably quicker too as you can get a direct tube into the city centre without having to go to St Pancras, where the high speed train goes to. The Westfield Centre had a fantastic selection of food outlets and restaurants; they've really gone for the Olympic theme with food from all over the world - only problem you might have is trying to decide where to eat. There's also a cinema and casino and one of the restaurants even has ten pin bowling lanes. We'd come to London to spend time in London but could easily have spent a full day shopping and so on at the centre. Really impressed with it and the hotel. We'll definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Kent_England_Sjw
Reviews.Content: Generally you know what you're getting with a premier inn - fairly basic accommodation at a reasonable price. This particular hotel though was excellent - £39 for a good sized room with an excellent view. The staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast excellent - much better than other premier inns I've stayed at. Automated check in was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay”
Reviews.Author: LadytravelsEssex
Reviews.Content: We had a one stay at the Premier Inn, Stratford and as usual, had a very comfortable stay. To celebrate my birthday, I decided on a shopping day, dinner and a visit to the Casino at Westfield. The Premier Inn is ideally located at the back of Westfield. However, there was no sign to direct you there, apart from the interactive machines in the shopping centre. Follow signs to Waitrose and then turn left and go outside. Ignore the car park signs, the hotel is just around the corner. We stayed on the 9th floor and had fantastic views over the Olympic park. You can't go wrong with a Premier Inn. Easy online booking and check-in, very comfortable rooms and a great nights sleep. Check out is 12pm - needed that after a late night at the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Asimabbasi
Reviews.Content: The old saying, "you get what you pay for..." is very true and very relevant to this hotel. In no way do I mean it in a negative manner. This hotel was by far the cheapest of the well known brands within London. I stayed with my wife for her birthday, and the criteria for the hotel, was for it be located in either zone 1 or as close as possible to it and in a quiet location. The latter is going to be rare in London. This hotel was in zone 3. Its a slight problem, but not a major issue. For the difference in price, I think the distance is compensated for. It is very quiet, but may not be during the olympics. The hotel isn't a 5 star hotel, and no way does it try to be. It is very clean, very quiet and just like any other Premier Inn hotel. No issues with the hotel. The room The room itself was clean, well maintained, in a good condition of repair. Just what you'd expect. No moans about the room, besides a couple, which is personal to myself, therefore will not be mentioned on here. Premier Inn have been made aware of it. Despite the smokescreen I have left above, it does not detract from me ever staying at a Premier Inn hotel, and nor should it stop others. I have stayed on numerous occasions, and this would be by far the best room/hotel I have stayed in, within the Premier Inn hotels. Really couldn;t complain about the room. Food Only had breakfast, which was satisfactory. Not as good as other breakfasts I have had at other Premier Inn hotels. The buffer bar, for the first time I have seen unmanned. Other Premier Inn hotels, (in which I have stayed at), have always been manned. Not a gripe, just an observation. The buffet bar seemed to have less choice than other Premier Inn hotels. Maybe a company policy change, or just this hotel. Food was not great, but for the price, it was OK. Staff Cannot fault the staff at all. All very polite, well dressed, approachable. Not much more to say about the staff. Didn't need to speak to them about any problems/faults, so cannot say how they would react or respond when things aren't as smooth running. Overall, the Premier Inn Stratford is good. Not great, as I believe you need to be a good 5 star hotel to achieve a 'great'. Its location is ok, if your prepared to catch and underground and a DLR, at the minimum to get it, and still a 2 minute walk from the station. Its right next to the Westfield Stratford shopping centre, which is massive, and has pretty much everything you need, in terms of retail/clothing/banking etc etc etc. I'd definately stay at this, or any other Premier Inn hotel again. Its probably a definate if you have young kids. Its not busy at Stratford International station, which is a relief if you are with kids, and the surroundings around the hotel, make you think..."am I really in the heart of London and next to where the biggest world event is due to take place in July 2012"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with only a few minor gripes”
Reviews.Author: TheSimpsonfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend 14/15/16 Jan. Quite easy to find if you do your homework otherwise not signposted. The easiest way from Stratford Train Station is onto lower ground at the Westfield. Walk right through to Waitrose. Turn right at the double doors to the right of Waitrose and right again. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very clean and spotless. Didnt get our requested view over the Olympic Park but not a major drama. Only gripes were the lifts which could be painful to arrive when you are on the top floor and our request for more towels was not met. Not the end of the world but we still had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: kraftygirl
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here last week as part of a 1-week stay in London. The hotel is located on the Central Line of the Tube above the Westfield Shopping Centre and right next to the Olympic Stadium, Velodrome, and Aquatic Centre. It takes about 5 minutes to walk from the station through the shopping centre and then a lift up to the first floor to check-in. We asked for a view of the stadium and were given a lovely room on the 8th floor with amazing views. There were 2 singles and 1 double bed (all ready made-up) which was better than some other higher-priced hotels that sometimes give you 1 double and one sofa bed for a family of 4. The hotel was spotless, very modern, and very clean. Breakfast was great, much better than the previous hotel we stayed in on the South Bank. The breakfast staff were all lovely and were great with the children. The quality of the food was excellent and although we did not take dinner in the hotel, I would certainly try it next time. Minor niggles were that messages did not seem to get passed on from day to night staff, or housekepping. We had no soap in our room for the entire stay and I left it to see if anyone would notice, and when they did not I mentioned it, but still it was not re-filled. There were other incidents too, but generally I found all the staff to be extremely courteous and professional when speaking with them. We spent £180 on 4 nights including breakfast which I thought was fantastic for a family. There are loads of restaurants and food courts in the shopping centre and we particularly liked the Japanese shop next to Waitrose for our evening meal, and the supermarket was very handy too. The shopping centre is pretty vast and we spent a good few hours having a wander round on Sunday. There is an Olympic shop in John Lewis if you are after some Olympic souvenirs, and a large viewing area off the back overlooking the Olympic facilities. It takes about 20 minutes to get into the centre of London by tube from here (the line does get very busy) so it's easily manageable for sight-seeing etc.. I would love to stay at this hotel again, we felt very much at home by the end of our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Inn London Stratford - Saturday Night Break”
Reviews.Author: Swiftcure
Reviews.Content: Great location 100% ideal for Westfield and fabulous restaurants. Amazing warm welcome, lovely and friendly staff throughout. Breakfast; great value for money. Overall all staff we dealt with within this hotel are a credit to the Premier Inn.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF & HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: tinavegas
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a saturday night at this great hotel and cant praise the staff anough right from checking in with Maria right through to the bar staff and restaurant it was excellent and made the stay for us all

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMay42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when we went to see the fireworks on New Years Eve. The staff are absolutely first class and this hotel has the fortune to be right next to the Olympic Stadium. The charming lady on reception, Sue, even took us to a higher floor room so we could take photos of the stadium. We had a laugh with the two ladies on bar/restaurant duty and all the staff we saw there were extremely helpful and polite. This hotel is also part of the Westfield Shopping Centre which we also enjoyed. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “'computer says no' attitude.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaTheExplorer
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend arrived after a long train journey with a whole weekend of things scheduled to do for my birthday in London. At check in there was a problem, as we had a email conformation with all the correct details they needed, however we did not have it in fax form, when our stay was booked over the phone we were not at all informed this would be a problem. The hotel was not at all busy, there were many staff with nothing to do, however after a member of staff slowly pondered for 20 minutes what he could do with us, we were left waiting for the manager for just over 20 minutes. who then just asked my boyfriend to have a fax sent over from his office, as if it would still be open at 7.30pm! By this time we'd been there over an hour and we had a dinner cruise booked for 8.30pm. Lo and behold as they were stalling so much I had to take my suitcase and change my clothes, wash and attempt to make myself look half decent for my birthday dinner cruise in their public toilets!!! Not nice for a girl on her birthday!!! I was totally appalled at the service, we were not at all taken care of, we were left standing there while staff just walked round in circles having the occasional chat. When it became apparent it was to late to now get the train to the dinner cruise, we asked one member of staff if she could please phone a taxi and explained it was urgent. She strolled - slower than a snail - over to the phone, picked it up and went to dial, then someone entered the room that she recognised, she looked over to me and put the phone down before begginning to have a very long chat with the girl who was clearly an aquaintance of hers. After 10 more minutes we asked another staff member to call us a taxi which he did so. The girl returned 20 minutes after we origionally asked her for our URGENT taxi and very rudely asked "Where did ya want that taxi to again?" BY THIS POINT I WAS FUMING! We had to leave our bags with management to go to the dinner cruise, and returned at 1am and spoke to a different manager - Sam I believe his name was - who was fair and gave us one night free and free breakfast. He was brilliant in comparison to the other staff members we had encountered - particularly the girl we asked to make the phonecall, she was so rude! Aside from all the hassle and stress our room was fine, apart from when I entered the bathroom and the door handle fell off leaving me in danger of being locked in. The breakfast presented a good choice of food, I like the fact that they use Yeo Valley organic yoghurts - good choice! Basically you wouldn't have this kind of issue with a smaller, family run hotel or guesthouse as they are flexible and care about their clients generally - whereas this Premier Inn seems to have a extremely 'computer says no' attitude. I was very upset by my encounter and I really wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ebba g
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, easily accessible, superb for shopping, very clean, quiet, good breakfast, staff very friendly, good security

Reviews.Title: “One Of Premier Inn's newest hotels - great when you find it!”
Reviews.Author: Alfierulestheworld
Reviews.Content: Slap bang in middle of new Westfield Shopping Centre next to Olympic Park. Very swish and brand spanking new . Automated check in and masses of helpful staff to help you use it. Exceptional staff at breakfast with a good selection of dishes including freshly cooked eggs. Only downside is finding it! Postcodes have changed recently in this area and there is no warning about this on the Premier Inn Website - sat navs will not find this hotel, and there are no signs to the hotel if you arrive on foot as I did having been dropped off at the entrance to the massive shopping centre by car. Someone at Premier Inn needs to get their act together about directions for pedestrians - this isn't my first experience of struggling with actually finding the place of foot - check out Premier Inn Newcastle Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - all round”
Reviews.Author: shaftesburygym
Reviews.Content: We arrived by tube and walked through the lower ground floor of the Westfield Mall to Waitrose, turned right, exit through the double doors, turn left and you're there. Easy ! Our friends took the high speed train from Kings Cross to Stratford International station which is also practically on the doorstep. The hotel was immaculate and the staff great. We had a problem with the aircon and mentioned it to the staff the following morning after an uncomfortable nights sleep. We were immediately offered a refund for the night and a change of room. Fantastic service. We got a great online rate. We enjoyed shopping in the mall, ice skating and eating in the choice of food courts and restaurants. There is also a cinema, bowling alley and casino on site so hardly any need to venture far. 7 stops on the tube and you are at Canary Wharf, more shopping! A few stops more and you are in central London. Highly recommended and have already booked to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a London hotel”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: The Premier Inn at Stratford met the expectations prior reviews had created. It is very clean and within easy reach of the heart of London by the Central line. The food and service at the restaurant is very good and reasonably priced and the restaurant is very pleasant. The automated check-in process was interesting, potentially impersonal, but the staff at the reception podium(!) were very friendly and always helpful. As noted elsewhere the bed was very firm, but not uncomfortably so for us, and the room was initially on the warm side but responded slowly to a lowering of the thermostat, which activated the air conditioning (in December!). The only negative was that the wash basin stopper would not retain water in the wash basin, which is a trivial matter. We were also amused to notice that the toilet was flushed with hot water. In summary, this hotel is very good value and we would not hesitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: SE
Reviews.Content: Superb location for a shopping weekend, with great tube access to Central London. Attentive, pleasant staff. Rooms very clean. Relatively large bathroom for London. Breakfasts were very good, buffet style. Great meal deal offer, if required. Was doubtful before we arrived. Was a convert when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near Olympic stadium and shopping mall”
Reviews.Author: jsjj88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and have almost no complaints. Slightly off London's city centre, but it takes at most 30 mins by tube to the central. This slight inconvenience is compensated by having an absolutely enormous Westfield shopping centre just beside the hotel. A seasoned shopper can easily spend more than a day in the mall. Requested for a high floor and got a room at the 9th storey. Stunning views of the Olympic stadium, and skyscrapers of the city serve as the backdrop. The room actually came with beds for 4, even though only 2 of us occupied the room. Room was very clean and bathroom came with a bathtub. Only complaint is that the soap dispenser in the bath room wasn't working. Other than that, I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best for Price and decent traveling time to High Street shopping”
Reviews.Author: jazzmate
Reviews.Content: Stayed for first 4 nites arriving in London. Location a bit far but on Central Line Tube so no need to change tube to Oxford Street. New area in London. Best if you are going to Olympics 2012. Hotel is new and spotless. Family room is decent sized and except for WC not flushing on my last nite, the rest of the days were enjoyable. The receptionist immediately changed to a room opposite when the WC can't be fixed on time since their maintenance worker on leave that day. Took train from Stratford International Station straight to St Pancras and only takes few minutes. Catching Eurostar to Paris. Very very convenient even though with few big luggages because not many passengers on that route. Will definenitely stay again if price is maintained around £70 per nite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PAUL D
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a new Premier Inn hotel, great location over looking the olympic village. On top of Westfields Startford City. We stayed for one night after a heavy day shopping, located at the furthest point from the tube station but a pleasant walk. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Imran123
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, cheap with cheerful staff. For a city hotel you can’t wrong. The location is very good; within walking distance from Stratford tube station that has excellent links into the City. Five minute train journey on National Express (non-stop) to Liverpool Street and also has the Central Line which will take you to Oxford Circus in about 12 minutes. We didn’t eat at the hotel as there are so many options at Westfield. My only gripe is that it was difficult to get hold of warm milk for the little ones. Although the staff was very helpful it was company policy to not heat-up milk. This needs to be resolved as there is no mini-bar in the rooms to store milk (can be purchased for £1 per glass) and also there are no self service heating facilities which makes it highly inconvenient if you have young children that demand warm milk at silly hours, like mine!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 22-24 December for an xmas break in London with our two children. We travelled to london St pancreas on train and then getting to the hotel was only a few tube stops, was very easy with children. We found the hotel very easily once we arrived was just next to John lewis as described. From check in to checking out could not fault the staff and service. They were fantastic with our children and definately made our stay in London. Rooms were great, as you'd expect with premier inn. I will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: steph21mz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you could want from a hotel. Children friendly, staff are brilliant couldn't do enough to help if asked for anything no matter how trivial. Perfect location! For shopping and tube links couldn't wish for better.

Reviews.Title: “A womans dream”
Reviews.Author: FunkyPhil51
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is the ideal location for proffessional shoppers ,its built into the new Westfield shopping centre which is a fantastic place , dont be put off men there is a bar right next to it that brew there own beer , and the tube station right next to it takes you into London in 10 mins , The hotel being new is excellent quality with great views over the olympic village and the staff were very helpful and always smilling , we went to shop for christmas and take in a show and see the sights , a great tip for you if you want to see a show is dont book on line or at the theatre to save you money book it in the Westfield centre box office , we saved a fortune , paid £23 each for Dreamboats & Petticoats tickets and the other shows were just as cheap , London is great but busy enjoy it we did .

Reviews.Title: “Needs to work out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: bmoregirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in late October. They had just opened the month before so the entire staff was extremely nice and helpful. Check in was lengthly but pleasant. Would definatley try to use the kiosks for express check in next time, but we had booked the breakfast and dinner combo and needed vouchers. We reserved two beds, but when we got to the room there was only one bed. Calling down to the front desk they said they would send someone up to give us keys to another room with two beds. 30 minutes later no one came, so we went back down to the front desk. We got a new room and when we entered again no second bed, but a sofa. Calling down again confused, they said the sofa was made into a bed. Housekeeping came about 15 minutes later and put a sheet and pillow on the sofa. It is not large but can fit one person. Breakfast was delicious definately worth the price and dinner was good as well. We had booked the dinner/breakfast combo for all three days but we decided to not use this on the last day and getting refunded became quite a hassle and confusing process. The credit went to a different room and receptionist kept asking a receipt which was never given to me, because they like to email it to you directly. After about an hour of working through getting a refund we were successful but was quite time consuming. The area the hotel is in is great as there are lots of dining and shopping options. The transit is also wonderful as it is on the tube and has a train that goes right to St. Pancreas. So fast and cheap to get from the Eurostar to the hotel. Beware on Sundays if you're trying to get to St. Pancreas for an early Eurostar that no local National Rail (Southeastern I believe) does not run before 10am. Hotel is very secure and safe, great location, and good prices. Would stay here again, but would give a few months for the staff to work out the little kinks.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for East London”
Reviews.Author: pjack68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife & two daughters the week before Christmas. We found the hotel easily as we had done some prior research to find out which car park was closest to the hotel (car park A). We soon found a space as on each level had a board telling you how many spaces were available per level and they also had lights on the roof next to each space that changed colour as to the availability of a space, green for available and red for taken. We entered the hotel on the ground floor and then went up to the first floor in the lift where the reception and the restaurant are located. They have lectern style check in desks and they both had customers at them being served so we used the self-check in units behind the two desks. The self-check in was an ok but we had to input details of all four of us and the machine also issued four keys. It would have been better if we could have been asked how many keys we required and why they need all of the people names in the room. I have stayed in many hotels and only premier inn ask the names of all of the occupants. We made our way up to our room on the 9th floor, we had a good view over looking the station and forthcoming Olympic site but we had an even numbered room, I think if you have an odd numbered room you will be over looking the stadium with central London behind. The room was nice and understated. Premier Inn seemed to have toned down the purple and brown wood branding into something a bit more contempory; there were white and beige walls with a painting on the wall. We stayed in one of their older properties last year and the room did look quite old fashioned. The room also had air conditioning, which was a bonus. The room was a good but not over generous size with a king size bed and two separate beds for the children all lined up next to one another, like one massive bed. There wasn’t much noise apart from the high speed trains going along the rail link to Europe about every hour or so. There is quite a lot of constriction around the site at the moment but the railway track was between the athlete’s village and us so we didn’t get any noise from the there. We had dinner at Giraffe restaurant; one of many in the Westfield centre, there is lots of choice there so you don’t have to dine in the hotels restaurant. The hotel is part of the complex but you still have to go outside for about 25 meters to get inside so you still may need a coat if it was very cold or raining as you will get wet if it is raining. It would have been better if you could gain access without going outside like so many shopping malls in North America. We all had a good sleep, as there were blackout curtains in the room and nice comfy beds. The breakfast was good and fairly good value at £7.99 each for adults with under 16’s eating for free. I don’t know how easy it is to get into central London by tube but if you are planning to leave your car there you will be charged all the time the car is parked. Our charge for 21 hours was £14.00 with allegedly two hours free parking and a £2.00 overnight charge; I did not get a receipt so the charging structure is a bit of a mystery. The hotel does not have its own car park so you will park with all of the shoppers. The staff were all very good and very professional and the hotel easy to get to. I would recommend this hotel for its ease of access by car and the additional shops, restaurants and leisure activities (cinema, ten pin bolwing, ice rink in winter & a really good free Santa’s grotto) if you need to be in East London and can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect London Base for a Mini Break!”
Reviews.Author: JulesMcC78
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the hotel for 3 nights over the last weekend in December before Christmas and we had a great stay. We wanted somewhere that had good transport access and as we would be out and about we didn't need to spend needless pennies on accommodation to be in the heart of the city. The location was easy to get to, we flew in from Stanstead, took the National Express coach which drops you off at the main Westfields entrance, easy! You can then either walk round the side of the centre to the hotel ot through the shopping mall like we did, if you do that aim for the John Lewis/Waitrose side of the centre. The centre is mammoth and it took us a moment to get our bearings. You can exit the centre on the ground floor close to the Waitrose entrance and head to the right, the Premier Inn Entrance is just outside. We arrived earlier than the check-in time and met by really lovely check in staff who were happy to take our bags for us and store them until we came back. So it was easy to have a shop wander, grab some food then go back to check-in. We made a request to be in a room with a view of the Olympic Stadium etc and the staff were glad to assist. For reference the odd room numbers have the view and our's was excellent, we were on the 10th floor. Our room was perfect for our stay, not lots of clothing storage but to be honest no big problem there. Bathroom was a good size too and was well maintained. On the whole clean, tidy and ideal for what we needed. The public areas of the hotel were really nice and plesant to sit in. We didn't do breakfast in the hotel but did grab a pizza and some drinks on one night and it hit the spot! Really liked that they had a nice festive drinks menu and again the staff made sure they checked that we were happy with everything we had. During the stay the staff couldn't have been more accommodating or helpful, all seemed happy to be there which always helps in the hospitality industry!! Transport wise, the rail/underground links were great, access to the DLR and the central line. Stratford station is approx 5/10 min walk through the mall, it doesn't feel long at all as like me you'll probably be window shopping en route! All in all a really good base for our trip and it was a bonus being able to wander the mall and see what it had to offer too. Check-out was also much better on the time front than many other hotels I've stayed in.12.30pm, perfect!! I would certainly go back and stay at this hotel, we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, but............”
Reviews.Author: Wico32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like a trip to London at Christmas and for the price the Premier Inn at Stratford offers great value when booked early to get the cheap rate. If you want to go into central London the tube station or bus (No. 25) are very close, and then after you can top up on your shopping at the new Stratford Shopping Centre, to be honest Stratford does not have anything else going for it. The staff were very helpful and our room was typical Premier Inn. I still cannot see why in new rooms they don't get rid of the bath and put in a wet room, that would earn it an Excellent rating. We had used our two complimentary tea bags, but wanted more, the front desk were very good and provided lots more with milk. My only criticism would be that other Premier Inns we have stayed in offer a contentinal Breakfast at a slightly cheaper price, but at Stratford they only offer the full cooked Buffet. All in all I will return again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: hop2it_11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel 30 minutes metro ride from central London or 6 minutes by high speed link. Hotel is accessible via the Westfield shopping centre. Go out of the train station go into the shopping centre and down the escalator, walk straight ahead for a good 5/7 mins walk until you reach the Spice Market in front of Waitrose supermarket - turn right and exit through the doors to outside area - P Inn is directly on your left. New hotel - spotlessly clean. friendly staff, good security - need to use swipe card to exit onto the floors, further swipe to get on to corridor and then into room. We stayed on the third floor room 301 overlooking the Olympic stadium and good views of London skyline - Post office Tower the Gherkin etc. Staff very friendly and helpful - Trish who served us dinner had a lovely warm Afro Carribean personality. All staff have a good smiley attitude. Good pub type menu - food very good both at dinner and breakfast - generous portions reasonably priced. Wine £10 per bottle. Bedroom was a family room - decent size, beds and pillow comfortable, linen fresh and all areas very clean. Had a good nights sleep - no noise from anywhere. Found this to be very good value for money and would recommend it. Room had kettle and hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Medal for Shoppers”
Reviews.Author: Blackout
Reviews.Content: Our 10th floor room on the southside (odd room numbers) offered a spectacular view of Olympic stadiums and cityscape. Northside rooms (even numbers) overlook Athletes Village and Stratford International/DLR stations. Room was standard Premier Inn, more than adequate for short stay. Only negative in the room as previous contributors have noted, windows sealed tight and room thermostat a tad unresponsive. Breakfast and snacks again Premier Inn standard and good value, particularly if purchased online in advance. Complimentary drinks if you have a main meal in the evening. Staff were absolutely lovely, without exception. Happy to recommend. Guys if your significant other suggests staying here, google Westfield Stratford before agreeing. 

Reviews.Title: “New hotel close the the Olympic Park”
Reviews.Author: olivespencer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly new and is in the new Westfield Shopping centre.There is loads of parking at Westfield and you can park very close to the hotel front doors. I was on the 9th floor over looking the Olympic Park. The rooms have space, they are clean and tidy, the bathroom is also in great condition. I found the staff to be very friendly too and have stayed twice in the last couple of weeks with virtually identical experiences. If you book early you can get a great rate, eat in Westfield as there is loads of restaurants in there and do a spot of shopping or go to the cinema. If you are going to the Olympics or Paralympics this is the perfect place to stay if its not already booked up!

Reviews.Title: “My home for 9 nights”
Reviews.Author: TonyV930
Reviews.Content: I was in London on business. Unfortunately, my stay was planned at the last minute and too near the holidays to be able to secure a hotel closer to my work (unless I wanted to take out a mortgage to pay for it, or stay in a place that was rated as "Poor" or "Terrible"). A colleague of mine suggested that I try Premier Inns, and I'm glad he did. Once I found the Premier Inn at Stratford, I knew that I had "My home for 9 nights". The staff was friendly and fantastic, the room was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast at the Thyme Restaurant was tasty and plentiful. My entire stay was a pleasure, and all my requests were met with prompt and courteous service. If you want an example of the attentiveness of the staff, here is probably the best example that I can think of. When I arrived at the Thyme restaurant for breakfast on probably the 2nd or 3rd morning of my stay, the host on duty (George) greeted me by name. I think that says it all. That level of detail and attention punctuated my entire 9 day stay. If you don't mind the 20 minute tube ride into central London, stay at the Premier Inn London Stratford. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, nice view and convenience of shopping”
Reviews.Author: Maky123
Reviews.Content: My family was assigned a room on Level 10, the highest level. We could see the ongoing works at the Olympic Park from our bedroom windows. We find the size of our family room bigger than the one in King's Cross. Possibly more floor area here to construct a bigger room. We also feel that the staff in this hotel is more attentive and courteous. The hotel is right next to Westfield Shopping Centre. After a day out at the museums or visiting sights in London city, you could spend the evening shopping after having your meals either at the fast food outlets or eateries at the shopping centre. This is especially convenient during winter when the skies turn dark after 4 pm. You could also catch movies at Vue Cinema inside the Shopping Centre. There is also an ice-skating rink outside the shopping centre when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “First Class, Brilliant position excellent service”
Reviews.Author: shanethechef
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, next to large shopping centre, room quiet, great views of olympic stadium. Highly reccomend, food good, staff excellent much better experience then exspected. And i got the room for four for £39.00 even better

Reviews.Title: “Not enough was "Premier - but the price"”
Reviews.Author: VFLondon
Reviews.Content: Let's hope things improve before the Olympics! If you come by car the hotel is hard to find as the online directions do not give enough detail of how to reach the car parks, exactly where it's best to park and how to get from the car park on foot to the main hotel entrance. If you approach from Car Park A round the outside it is quite gloomy and badly lit, which doesn't help. The hotel entrance is anonymous - no staff, no welcome signs - unlike other Premier Inns. The lift to Reception can take ages to arrive but don't use the stairs, which, as they warn you, have well over 100 steps. When we arrived at the upstairs Reception, the 'lectern' style reception desks were empty and staff preoccupied with other people's problems. However, when we did meet staff later they were very friendly and helpful - and the best feature of our experience here. The automated check-in works best with the booking reference, not your card! The two rooms we used were smaller than expected and did not match the expectations fostered by current advertising. One of them was badly designed and laid out so we didn't have room to store more than cabin sized luggage. It was uncomfortable for more than an overnight stay, rather claustrophobic, with a very narrow window, low ceiling and not enough space for Lenny Henry to swing a cat! Even the bed seemed smaller than in other Premier Inns. The 2nd room was also a bit cramped for a family. The cot we booked was in a small space by the window. In trying to move the over-long net curtain to keep our grandchild safe while letting her see out of the window, the curtain pole sprang loose and hit me in the head causing swelling & bruising that took 3 weeks to subside. The fact that this could have happened to a small child - or pierced my eye, which it just missed - concerned me greatly. I spoke to a member of staff who promised to notify the management. She was friendly, efficient and prompt in offering a full refund. None of us had slept as a result of the shock of the accident and the overheating. However, no-one contacted me subsequently to check that I had recovered fully or to reassure us that steps would be taken to fix the sprung-loaded curtain tracks properly to avoid injury to other clients. The midweek prices are often over £100, which, for staying next to a (current) building site and shopping centre with teething problems, feels a bit steep in view of the advertising strap-line that implies high quality but budget pricing. However, if you can book one of the cheap deals, enjoy shopping centres, don't need to use what can be expensive parking and are assigned one of the larger family rooms which isn't overheated, it could be a much better experience than we had.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Inn - very good”
Reviews.Author: PaddyJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 4th floor and had no problem with noise. This is a very convenient hotel for Stratford and the shopping centre. Not so difficult to locate as we thought, based on previous reviews. From bus and tube go up the steps, enter shopping centre at Forever 21, go right thru to John Lewis and down escalator to Waitrose. Outside then and it's on your left, pretty much attached to shopping centre. The staff were extremely friendly, helfpul and welcoming. Rooms were standard for Premier Inn, no complaints, considering we had a twinroom for 3 nights for £235. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment. However, there were lots of really good cafes and restaurants on the top floor of the shopping centre. I would definitely return to this hotel next visit to London - great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “A bit warm, but great friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkCarl
Reviews.Content: On the whole first class. Very friendly service. Only downside was the room was very hot, even tried turning the thermostat down and could not open the window. Food in the hotel was good and excellent value for money. And its a little difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: cchrippes
Reviews.Content: the hotel and rooms were clean,the staff were friendly and helpful making our family trip one that we will always remember

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mikieol
Reviews.Content: We got a triple room for £29/€33. We arrived at 12, so they minded our luggage as we began our shopping. Our check in at about half 2 was effortless. The room was very spacious and extremely modern. The Christmas music set a lovely homely atmosphere. We were late checking out so we couldn't get back into our room but a staff member opened our room door and we checked out and once again they minded our luggage. We were given free drink vouchers and we had a lovely dinner; £11 for 2 courses. Couldn't recommend it enough, staff were so friendly. Definitely returning. :)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: noobhands
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews here, and thought they were mostly good. The reception is actually on the first floor, which is fine - it stops pesky people who shouldn't be there from going in. Got to the hotel about 2pm, and the room still wasn't ready - but that was fine, they took my bags and put to storage and informed me that it would be maybe 30 minutes or so and showed me the bar for a snack/drink. Prices were pretty good considering it's a hotel. The bar staff even informed me that it was cheaper to get 3 bottles of beer instead of 2 (deal running at the time) which was polite.
