When my room was ready, a member of staff came over to let us know that it was ready when we were ready to check in... They had 3-4 express check-in machines, which was very simple to use, had a member of staff right behind me in case something went wrong during this process - painless. It's about 15 minutes from everything in central London, and on the Central Line for ease. In the same lobby on the first floor, there are 3 vending machines - one for drinks (bottles of coke etc), one for snacks and cans of drink and and the top of one it had some items you may have forgotten, e.g. toothbrush/toothpaste (pack), shaving foam and razor and so on - didn't need it, but it was good to know if something was missed. I used the advice that I read on here, getting a room facing the shopping centre - there was pure silence, good for my partner who is a light sleeper. The room was pretty big, it was a family room marked as a room for two... So we even had the 3rd single bed there :) Room was spotless with plenty of room. The house keeping staff were also very polite and cheerful when we walked past - always asking how our days were, and if we were having a good stay and such! As I'm a bit of a nerd, and tech buff - one of the first things I looked at was the TV! TV was showing Freeview channels and were Samsung TVs and did indeed have a USB port and HDMI port free on the back, which was handy as I could plug my hard drive in to watch TV/Movies. My only gripe, was the location/sign posting... We walked past the side of John Lewis went around, and there was a huge flight of stairs - down here is an Entrance to the Car Park and to the right the shopping centre, it's around the corner from here - but there was no sign posts anywhere helping people to find it. I noticed when we were going out into the Westgate centre or outside having a cigarette that people with suitcases were having trouble locating it, but we helped them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ended up leaving. We couldn't sleep.”
Reviews.Author: olireviews
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night making use of their Free Night Giveaway. The room would of cost £103.00 which is pretty steep, but was in a good location however thanks to their offer it was free. We were in the Stratford area at around 5:30pm but thanks to the hotel being new and on a new road in the Olympic Park no sat nav or Google Maps could pick up the address. After ages finding the entrance to the shopping centre we parked up and went in and asked the touch screen machine where it was. Even after that we were confused. It was round a corner outside, behind the shopping centre. Once in, we were greeted with a warm welcome and checked in swiftly. Our room was 414 facing the train station and general grounds of the Olympic Park (not the stadium, however). The room itself was nice enough I suppose, the bathroom was small but clean and there was plenty of storage space. We booked a family room with a main double bed and single bed in the corner. We returned from dinner at around 9.00 exhausted and went to bed. First of all, the room was very hot as was most of the hotel so it took ages to get the room to a decent temperature. After over an hour it was getting cooler but still warm. The problem was the beds were very hard. Not at all like any other Premier Inn I have stayed in. Perhaps because the hotel was new, it was very uncomfortable, coupled with the fact that the pillows were lumpy as well. After 3 hours of trying to sleep and it was quarter to one in the morning, it was clear we wern't getting any sleep so decided to pack up and drive 90 mins back down to Brighton, to home where we could get a proper night's sleep. Thank goodness we didn't pay £103.00 to stay here! After what seemed an age trying to check out with one member of staff, going to fetch another to try and cancel breakfast for the following morning and all the fuss with that, it was 1:30 in the morning and by the time we got home and got to sleep it was gone half 3. So summed up - if you are used to hard, lumpy beds then you should be alright staying here, but we found it awfully uncomfortable and we couldn't get a good nights sleep, as well as the fact it was far too warm, no matter what you did. Would I reccommend? Not at all, but don't let it put you off the Premier Inn chain, most of the other hotels I have stayed in have been perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Olympics and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Ausman46
Reviews.Content: We needed a good hotel in the East End, close to friends at a good rate. The Premier Inn at STratford International fitted the bill. It's brand new - opened in Sept 2011 and is in the middle of the precinct for the 2012 Olympics. It's on top of the Westfield Stratford Shopping Centre - largest in Europe. Good size rooms with extra seating, a desk and plety of storage space. Tea/coffee making. Large bathroom. And a ridiculously cheap breakfast - 8 English pounds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: SaminCalabriaUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as we were attending the Mencap Little Noises Session in Hackney (10 minutes away by cab). We were in Room 901 so had a fantastic view of the Olympic stadium and surrounding area - if you're booked in for next Summer's Games, you won't be disappointed! Spotlessly clean, outstanding staff and service and a fantastic location means we'd definitely return - and stay a bit longer for a shopping trip in Westfield.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: holiday013
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, right beside the shopping centre, the hotel was very clean, rooms large, bathroom was a good size with toiletries included. The staff were really friendly and always smiling, the food was brilliant we had the all you can eat for £7.99 buffett breakfast and for evening the 2 course meal for £11.99, it was all worth the money and good quality food. Our weekend was for leisure and I would certainly stay here again. Well done managers and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay, Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maz38_11
Reviews.Content: This is a fantasic hotel to stay in. It is about 20 mins from the city and attractions. It is right next door to the new Westfield shopping centre so has something for everyone. The resturant is also brilliant, great service and food choice, breakfast was wonderful also good if your on a buget. We had a family room for one night and there was plenty o space. The room has air con so is just perfect. This Hotel is very new so every thing looks great, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron G
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to (Stratford International) or Stratford (Jubilee, Circle, DLR) are really close by. New build hotel with its own restaurant - go for the £22 dinner/breakfast. You get a 3-course meal (including 10oz Rump Steak if you so choose) plus a glass of wine or pint of beer and an all-you-can eat breakfast (English and/or continental). Very helpful staff in both Reception and the restaurant. From the 5th floor modern, clean and quiet bedroom had a great view of the Olympic Stadium and Park etc. The Westfield Shopping Mall is located right next door and also includes a 17-screen cinema, a bowling alley and a casino (soon to open). Only mini-complaint was that the Reception was on the 1st floor which meant frequent trips in the lift between Ground, 1st and 5th floor levels but this is a very minor point and really does improve the security of the building at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jofoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally locatated over-looking the Olympic park and village. Easy to get into central London via the underground. Our family room on the 7th floor was clean and airy, with a view of the Olympic village which is still under construction. Beds were comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. Breakfast is buffet style with plenty of choice and very tasty. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: pimdo
Reviews.Content: came here 2 weeks ago to stay to look round the new westfield shopping centre, hotel is in prime site right in the shopping centre and next door to where the new olympic stadium being built, altho lots of building all around did not effect our stay. staff very helpful and rooms very clean and new, fresh towels, kettle with tea and coffee, flat screen tv , had dinner in their restruant very nice steak and service good, prices were reasonable for hotel, good selection of wines would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: WindermereBoys
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and the rooms clean and comfortable. The hotel is located next to the Stratford Westfield Shopping Centre with lots of shopping opportunities, places to eat and a multiplex cinema. My room was on one of the upper floors and had a great view. My only complaint was that as a light sleeper I was aware of trains passing the hotel and platform announcements. A normal sleeper probably would not notice this but on departure I mentioned this and it was suggested that next time I book I request a room overlooking the shopping centre. Overall I would recommend this hotel and it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: craig a
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our grandson for the sunday evening, Excelent location to the new Westfield shopping centre, Be careful with the parking if you get there after 6.00 pm you only pay for the overnight parking fee which is upto 8.00am then move the care out of the car park and back in and you get 2 free hours. The hotel is new very very nice they need to settle down a little let the staff levels get to the correct amount for the size of the hotel very short staffed when we were there but we didnt let it spoile the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sangram_das
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent! Apart from having a problem in finding it as it is a new property and very few cab drivers are aware of it. Perfect value for money. Breakfast spread for Indians and specifically vegetarians might be a problem if you donot like continental food. Right infront of the tube station so you have to just step out and get onto the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable, clean, great location, staff need better training!”
Reviews.Author: rustythestarlight
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 weeks on 3 occasions! The hotel is in an amazing location on top of the Westfield shopping centre and overlooks the Olympic park! The rooms were spotlessly clean that I bought some Mr Matey bubble bath for a relaxing rest, perfect! The reception is great when your quick check in works, but as they only have 2 manual check in desks, if you need help and you have large groups ahead of you, be prepared to wait 30 mins, however the receprion staff were very helpful and caring and apologetic. The food in the restaurant is soooo good and very good priced. Now here's the moan: the restaurant staff are so rude. One night I was waiting for 30 mins just for a drink, let alone ordering food, after waiting and watching the waiter flirting with guests asking for Their phone number...I just walked out! The week after all I was going to ask the girl on the restaurant desk was "can I book a table for 7pm?" I didn't even finish my sentence and she raised her hand to my face and said "wait, someone will come" then turned her back to me to do stuff on the till, she didn't even know what I was going to ask! So I walked off as I was gobsmacked! It's a really nice hotel, it's a shame the restaurant staff are so rude or fake nice! The only saving grace was trish and charlotte who were geuine and had great service skills. All that's needed is better organisation, and training in customer service in the restaurant. This advice is for their own good as come the olympics they wont know what hit them!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: millersmanor
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay with my husband. Found the hotel fantastic, had an amazing view over the olympic stadium. Staff were excellent, breakfast was great we also had an evening meal in the restaurant and this was of excellent quality. If you enjoy shopping the hotel is buiilt on top of the westfied shopping centre which is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “all round excellence”
Reviews.Author: rosie5519
Reviews.Content: Amazing location bang in the middle of the Olympic site - fascinating to watch the work going on. Not only that but close to overground and underground stations and right next to Westfield Shopping Mall. Room design was excellent - plenty of mirrors and sockets. Really enjoyed breakfast - ask for the porridge! Very friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “make the most of it while it's new”
Reviews.Author: edhuwjim
Reviews.Content: Carpets clean and springy, bathroom fittings shiny and new, walls well decorated, excellent breakfast with endless Costa coffee from 2 machines, so no queues. Views over olympic park interesting (as faces canary wharf and gherkin as well), but the room we had looking the other way had a much bigger window and a lovely general cityscape beyond the car parks of the westfields shopping centre. Car park cost us a pleasantly surprising £12 (just shows what's happened to parking charges!) for 24 hrs over a Sunday night. It costs £26 on other days, not the £10 stated when you book with prem Inn. You can't open the windows so the rooms can be far too hot and stuffy. The air con doesn't seem to do anyting except make a quiet background hum. The double rooms and family rooms seem to be the same size, so they're a decent double but a pretty small room for 4, a fair bit smaller than other prem inns we have stayed in. Checking in was interesting as it seemed that not all rooms were available at the 2pm time for checking in. I mean, that needs to be sorted out! It meant that we ended up on different floors! But at £29 per room and with a fab breakfast and good shopping it was a good deal. You get the usual mix of people, from high-brow intellectuals like myself (joking) to some people you wish were staying somewhere else, but mostly OK. Go for it at room prices of less than £50, remembering the steep car parking charge (TINA).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: VRajshekhar
Reviews.Content: Ideal place to stay amidst the shopping malls and near the metro line. Very well connected with the central London. Staff very helpful. Value for money. Wi-fi exists but expensive. £5 for 36 min. Self checkin is not fully functional but there're friendlystaff to help u out. Stay is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Danielle B
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a two day/ one night stay in London. I went with my husband and 2 children. We stayed on the 8th floor and couldnt have asked for better. We overlooked the Olympic park, we were so excited and enthralled we slept with the curtains open!! The room was a family room, compact but extremely comfortable and clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was organised and delicious. I am definitely staying here again. One other thing, it is adjacent to the new Westfield shopping centre. We never shopped but we could see right down into it which at night was an extra bit of fascination!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel - gold medals all round.”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: I, along with my wife and two daughters, recently had the pleasure of staying at the Premier Inn, Stratford for a long weekend break in the Capital. First off, getting there is a doddle, Circle or Jubilee line to Stratford City, and a reasonably short walk through Westfield towards the Waitrose end (note: it gets busy in the evenings). Or take the DLR to Stratford International (which exits at the hotel door!) Sorry, I can't comment on parking or driving through the miriad of building works going on for 2012. This is a great base for exploring London, why pay £100+ a night more to be central when this is just a tube ride away? Well, the tube does get very busy and if you can't stand for more than 30 minutes you might want to look elsewhere for accomodation, but that's London. You might find the DLR a little less congested, but I can't really comment. The hotel itself was only 4 weeks old when we visted and it is very nice for a budget hotel. I must admit I am a little biased, I like PI, I know pretty much what I'm going to get before I arrive and I know I'll be able to sleep on the "strange" bed. When travelling with family, it's nice to be able to sleep in the same room and the cost doesn't ruin your weekend. Stratford is no exception, if anything, it's a little better, it had the feel of a business class hotel, like a decent Hilton. We had a great room with fantastic views of the Olympic stadium and pool, It was again, as expected, clean and with good air con. although I find the milk tubes they provide for tea and coffee a little miserly. The restaurant is not the usually attached pub, but a proper hotel restaurant. There are some great views of the Olympic village and the staff are superb. I really can't praise the staff enough. From entering the lobby (on the first floor) you are greeted with warmth and genuine good nature. I was genuinely interested in the Olympic works going on and everyone I asked could impart a little snippet of information. I was really impressed on our last morning when it looked like the whole hotel had come down to breakfast at the same time. The restaurant manager was very apologetic and the staff very helpful, we still managed to have a very enjoyable breakfast, without feeling the stress that the staff were obviously under. Well done you guys! My only critisisms would be 1) the lifts seem to take for ever, they seem to always go to the top floor before coming back down. Maybe it's me, but I did have to wait 12 minutes to get a lift back to my room one morning - they did come, but were always full! and 2) No free wifi - this is the 21 Century. I can't believe that ANY hotel in the developed world would not offer free wifi access - it stinks of meanness, that penny pinching nature that you find in some big name hotels. I hope this helps anyone looking to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good for shopping but some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: LorianNod
Reviews.Content: great location for westfields shopping . Nice new clean. Hotel by the olympic stadium. Some minus points though: Everywhere in the hotel is hot. In the room you need the air conditioning on all night which is noisy. Worst thing is staying on the olympic village side you get woken at 05:07 each morning when the first high speed train of the day roars past. Beds are pretty hard too. The third bed in the room is actually more comfortable than the main double! Twenty minutes to check in because the checkin machines were not working. Staff were apologetic though. breakfast queue was twenty minutes yesterday just to get seated then it was a scrum for the food like something from butlins. too few staff and the buffet area too small given the number of guests. Those staff present seemed tired already, I feel sorry for them.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: g00dygumdr0ps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights, it is located right next to the big shopping centre and tube station which is very handy. Room was a standard premier inn hotel, which is always great to stay in. Room clean, and great view from the 5th floor that we stayed in. Only thing to say is that twice we had housekeeping enter the room when we were there, and one time was half 8 in the morning, which woke me up!

Reviews.Title: “New & Comfortable With Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: R8SKM
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel which has recently opened in late summer 2011. I have stayed there on 3 occasions and have always been impressed by the friendly service and obvious cleanliness with it being new. The rooms are standard Premier Inn fair and none the worse for that. Everything is new and fresh with comfortable beds and functional bathrooms. The flat screen televisions have access to all UK Freeview channels and many radio stations. You could never describe the hotel as luxurious but it is comfortable enough and I would make special mention of the staff who are very friendly and helpful. You may want to try for a high room (floors 7-10) on the south side of the building to benefit from some very good views over London. There is some construction work for the Olympic site (next door) and so there is a little noise but I didn’t find it too intrusive. The hotel did have one or two teething troubles as might be expected. The self check-in facility now works fine it would seem. However, when my air conditioning did not work for example, I was immediately offered a full refund for that night’s accommodation as the hotel was full. Excellent customer service indeed. As has been mentioned, it takes a little finding if you’re coming by underground. Basically, get off the underground at Stratford and head for the Westfield Shopping centre. It’s about a 10 minute walk through the shopping centre at a leisurely pace or with luggage. You need to walk right through the ground floor of the shopping centre to get to the hotel. You’ll pass Marks & Spencer on your left and keep walking past the food court on your left until you see Waitrose (handy for essential supplies). Then head out of the shopping centre doors and you’ll see the hotel. The West End is around 25 minutes away on the Central Line. Stratford International Rail Station is much closer to the hotel and a train from there gets you to Kings Cross/St Pancras in less than 10 minutes. There is a restaurant and bar one in the hotel which offers UK pub-style food for less than £10. A walk into the adjacent Westfield Centre (open until 9pm on weekdays) offers a food court on the ground floor with a range of fast food restaurants such as KFC, McDonalds, Subway, Chinese, Caribbean etc. Venture upstairs in the Centre and there’s an even bigger choice of restaurants with everything from the usual chain restaurants to Thai and Japanese cuisine. The Shopping Centre itself has a fantastic range of designer and chain stores. All in all then, a good choice balancing value for money and comfort if you don’t mind being a little out of town or are visiting either the Olympic Stadium or Westfield Shopping Centre. I fully recommend it on that basis.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: LandD2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the premier inn in Stratford for 2 nights whilst on business at the Olympic Park. It is right next to Stratford International station so I caught the train from St Pancras direct to there after I arrived at Kings Cross. This saved messing about with the tube and all my luggage. The hotel was the normal premier inn identical style, it was quite a small room and I was disappointed that you couldn't open the window to allow air in. There is a heating and cooling system in the room though. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the duty manager, the people manning the check in desks and the greeter at breakfast. On my second night from 9pm until at least 1030pm there was a loud hammering noise. I phoned reception to ask how long it was going to go on for. They weren't sure where the noise would be coming from as they had no work taking place and hadn't been advised of any night time works nearby. The duty manager offered for me to change rooms or to use the good night guarantee and claim a refund. I did neither, as it seemed to be beyond the control of the hotel and I was so tired that I had fallen asleep by 10.30, so if the hammering was still going on, I was oblivious to it. Breakfast was good, in a buffet form, but regularly refreshed. I didn't eat an evening meal in the hotel, instead I explored the adjacent Westfield shopping centre and surrounding restaurants. The best hotel I have stayed in in Stratford when visiting the Olympics site.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, smart, friendly...hot!”
Reviews.Author: gingerrosie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with our 2-year-old. Wouldn't ordinarily comment on a Premier Inn as they are pretty much the same, but staff deserve a mention for their friendliness and attention to detail. Even had child-size cutlery...first time I have ever seen this in any restaurant/hotel. We had a room on the 10th floor so amazing views of the area. Small room but all clean and functional. Have never stayed in a Premier Inn and been cold but why they have winter thickness duvets on the beds when the rooms are so well insulated and the whole building is warm makes me wonder... All in all, a great location as only 6 minutes from St Pancras on the Southeastern high speed trains, but far enough away from Central London to make things feel a little more relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and nice location”
Reviews.Author: lou4uuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location next to westfield shopping centre, when the shopping centre is open you can just walk through the shopping centre, when the shopping centre is closed you can catch the dlr tube line from stratford to stratford international and when you get off it 2 mins walk from the station. The hotel was very clean and well presented. We had a eveing meal at the hotel and the staff were really friendly and the breakfast was one of the best we have had. We would def go to back this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Westfield”
Reviews.Author: Chocolato-Milko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here couldn't believe that its actually built on side of westfield!! Bar serves good range of wine and staff were really helpful! Couldn't believe the breakfast was only £7.99 would have paid double! We had excellent time many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, 5 stars for Abid”
Reviews.Author: The-travellerrr
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, especially Abid from reception that did more than everything he could to help, and was one of the best host I met, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zubair30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Premier Inn for two nights on the 7th and 8th October. A colleague of mine had stayed at the hotel two weeks before and had told me that the hotel was a little difficult to find. When we got there we did have to ask a couple of people for directions before we found it. Follow these directions and you will find the hotel in no time: Coming out of the tube follw the Westfield Stratford City signs, enter the shopping centre on the left and walk straight down that floor until you see the Great Eastern Market/Waitrose. Turn right and out of the doors and Premier Inn will either be on your right or left side, depending on which exit you come out of. In terms of where we wanted to stay in London, Premier Inn was the cheapest at £118 for two nights and we booked it from their website. When we got there we found out we were on the second floor and as it was a birthday trip, asked if we could have a room on a higher floor. The lady who served us was very helpful and accomodating and not only gave us a room on a higher floor, but gave us a room on the very top floor, the 10th floor! We were very happy as you can imagine. The room had a great view of the Olympics Stadium and two other venues, one being the Aquatics Centre. The hotel offers self-check in, however, we were served by a staff member. When we asked for an Iron on Friday evening, as we entered the lift we met a member of staff on on his way to our room to give us the iron. Service was very good. Obviously as it is within the Westfield Centre it is ideal if you are visiting for shopping, however, like us, if you are just looking for a nicely priced hotel near the centre-ish you can't go wrong with this. The bed was one of the most comfartable we have slept on and it is fair to stay we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to stay for shopping at Westfield.”
Reviews.Author: Waikit88
Reviews.Content: I booked one night stay as I was shopping in the new WestField shopping centre. I drove to Stratford and the parking rates are expensive as 24 hours is £26.00. On the premier inn website, it states parking is £10.00 overnight but this is not true. I arrived after 6.00pm and they have special rates for £2.00 from 18:00 to 07:59 overnight parking. The hotel is right next to Zone A car park entrance. Take the car park lift to the ground floor and walk out to the main entrance and you need to head towards Stratford international as premier inn is opposite to the station. You will need to take the lift to the 1st floor reception where staff greet u and you have to check in on the self service kiosks. The room was presented well and was very clean. There is no fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Escafeld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night recently. Usual Premier Inn room identikit room, which is always of a higher quality than other budget chains. The two big selling points for me though were the fact the hotel is cheap for London, and if you get a HS1 train from St Pancras (£5 return into the centre) you can go from the platform at St P to the hotel in under 8minutes. I wouldn't even be down at tube level in that time at KKStP underground! Also, another big selling point is depending on what side of the hotel you get on you get a SPECTACULAR view of the Olympic park and the city skyline behind.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, and so easy to find (once you read my review)”
Reviews.Author: FrekwentFlajer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the very best holiday/3* hotel I have ever stayed at. Everything was perfect, but for one thing.....without which I can't see how they call it a business hotel....a room safe. The bed is very comfortable, the carpets spotlessly clean and thick, the restaurant quite good (and very good value for money), staff always ready to walk the extra mile. Within minutes of my request, an ironing board and iron had been sent up to my room. No charge for freephone numbers when using the room phone! Breakfast abundant. Seemed like it was full house just 2 weeks from day 1. And yes, it is hard to find unless you know it is just in front of the Stratford International DLR station (note, this is not the same station as Stratford!!!!!)....you just can't miss it....walk out of the door of this eerily quiet station and look up to your right (it is just 20metres away). Complaints: toilet paper is 1-ply, easily solved by buying a packet from Waitrose next door! Security: Never felt unsafe in the vicinity (and if you read my other reviews you will see I give this due attention) Restaurants & Shopping: Spoilt for choice at Westfield next door. Transport: Bus D8 every 12-15mins from stop W 3mins walk away (at the end of the shops' loading bays) goes to Canary Wharf and Crossharbour Asda. Jubilee and Central tube lines pass through Stratford Station which is just 10mins from Stratford International by DLR (or walk right through Westfield). Transport zone 3 (slightly more expensive but well made up for by the cheap night rate - distance not an issue due to good tube/DLR/bus connections). Windows sealed tight but A/C provides both heating and cooling! Room was perfectly sound-proof. Find this useful? Show your appreciation by voting so!

Reviews.Title: “Great location impersonal service”
Reviews.Author: KelvinYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The rooms are all standard Prem inn which are good. Very new hotel in a huge shopping complex a 10 min walk from Stratford tube. Automated check in ok but impersonal. Restaurant actually very smart for a Pi but they didn't seem prepared for the number wanting food. Staff were friendly in restaurant although the one bar guy did seem a bit overwhelmed. Bonus was my room faced over the Olympic park.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with a few sticking points”
Reviews.Author: Quincybella
Reviews.Content: I really like the Premier Inn brand, so pretty much knew what to expect from this hotel, and in the main it did deliver. We specifically booked because we wanted to check out Westfield, and it was worth the trip for that if you are keen shoppers; it is far bigger than the W1 Westfield and has a lot more to offer. You could do worse than to stay there for a general trip to London, although as you are in Zone 3 you have to be prepared to spend more time and money on travelling. The pros of this hotel are the location, if you are interested in shopping and/or the Olympics. Additionally it is very close to Stratford tube and Stratford International is right opposite the hotel. Stratford tube is useful as the Central Line and Jubilee Line both run from it. More positives were finish of the room - everything was (quite rightly, considering it was brand new) immaculate. The bed, in particular, was really comfortable. The towels and bedding were also soft and very clean. The staff were absolutely lovely, without exception, and seemed to really care about whether you enjoyed your stay. Despite being over the bar our room was quiet and the sound-proofing was excellent. Even though it was 30 degrees when we stayed we found the air conditioning more than adequate - in fact we had to turn it down. The room was fairly sparsely furnished but the TV was good, and the carpet was spotless. The cons (and I admit I am nitpicking somewhat) are that the hotel is really badly signposted, and as it is located at the end of a REALLY busy shopping centre it might be hard to find. I was lucky as I had been before and I knew where I was headed. The door of my room stuck very badly and I had to put my full force into opening it every time. Breakfast on the Sunday was pretty chaotic, and the staff tried really hard, but struggled to keep up with demand. The restaurant was vast, and nicely decorated, but it accommodated more people than they could actually deal with. As a result the queue for hot food, toast etc. was pretty long and the veggie sausages I requested just never arrived. The lifts we also pretty slow but luckily as we were on the second floor we more often than not took the stairs. Trifling things, really, but things which detracted a bit from what it overall a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Best nights sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: Toria L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in September and we are young students. This hotel is brand new and gorgeous! Very safe with keycards to get up to your floor and into the hall where your room is. I cannot say enough about the beds! Comfy and cloud like. Getting up from them was very hard because you could easily lie in bed all day! The air conditioning got as cold as you wanted! And the tv had many channels. Had to pay for wifi though. It is several tube stops into central London but it is by far the cheapest nicest hotel you'll find anywhere as close to 20 minutes into the city. I would love to stay here again! Lovely helpful staff and the breakfast was delicious! Expensive, but thats London :)

Reviews.Title: “Olympic views from the window you cannot open”
Reviews.Author: Andrew3009
Reviews.Content: Well the view from the 7th floor is spectacular. Olympic stadium and aquatics centre in front of you, Westfield shopping right under you. But during the hottest September for years can you believe that this brand new hotel which presumably will be chocka block next summer does not have proper air con in it's rooms and windows which do not open to even try and let some fresh air in!! The fan system did it's best but was not man enough for the 28 degree heat. The lovely thick duvet will be great for cold winter nights but just got thrown off in the heat. Having said that, the location and value were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and terrific value”
Reviews.Author: CoolumCat
Reviews.Content: After being one of the first guests to check into this hotel on opening day 13th September 2011, we were quite delighted with its location, and that it was a brand new hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The price for the room was great and offered good value. A little hard to find by road, but the Stratford International Railway Station is right next door to the hotel, which makes for a departure to St.Pancras for the Eurostar to Paris, even easier. The local tube station Stratford is on the other side of the Westfield shopping centre and very well integrated into this busy hub. Westfield Stratford City is an amazing shopping precinct and the largest in Europe, so it was a real treat to see the opening of this new London icon too. Having the hotel next door to the centre is very appealing and suited our needs very well. The room was a little small, but the beds were comfortable. I was fortunate enough to get a room overlooking the new Olympic stadium, so ask for this if you can at the time of the booking. As you would expect all the facilities in the room were modern and well presented. One big mistake the owners have made though, was that there was no bar fridge or mini bar. It would have been nice to be able to place some items we had such as water & milk in a fridge. The breakfast is superb, and if you are travelling with children, make sure you pay for the premium breakfast which means that kids eat free. You can even request an omelette instead of the scrambled eggs on offer. The bar is well stocked but unfortunately this is where the hotel fails to deliver. Opening days are the most testing times for staff, but having dining room waitresses behind the bar serving is an obvious mistake that should not happen. Not knowing how to pull a beer is embarrassing for staff and worse for the customers. Patrons were forced to show staff how to pull a beer, so there was an obvious lack of staff training which I am sure will be rectified in the future. All in all, a good experience and this will be the hotel of choice when staying in London, purely for its location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Abbey999
Reviews.Content: Agree with everything in the first reviewfor this hotel (Niall_mcdonald). It IS a review for the Premier inn in Straftord, LONDON (Olympic park). Was the cheapest hotel in london, yet we got a great location with the new Westfield shopping center etc right next door. Watch the cost of car park - if you only stay one night and don't hang around on leaving, it can be ok, otherwise it can build up. Only other thing to watch is the machines that can optionally be used to check-in - don't use them if you have more than one room booked, as they make you checkin one room at a time and you can end up with rooms nowhere near each other. Otherwise, a real bargain - we love Premier Inn anyway - this is a new one as good as any. - rooms clean and comfortable as always.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: niall_mcdonald
Reviews.Content: OK so it looks like tripadvisor have listed this in Stratford-upon-Avon, not Stratford, London initially - hopefully this will be resolved! Anyway, I can vouch for the fact that this hotel is in east London, and is well worth a visit. We stayed 16-18 September on the first weekend after opening, and we had a great stay. £134 for 2 night, and I can see it cheaper for future bookings. The hotel is built right on top of the Westfield Stratford City shopping centre, and is next to the Olympic Park. So easy to get to thanks to the new infrastructure being put in place for the Games - you have a choice of tube lines into the newly upgraded Stratford underground, overground services to Stratford International, or DLR into the new Stratford International stop. Just note you need a Zone 1234 travelcard to get to Stratford. We had no teething troubles on our stay - room was spotless, beds comfortable, bathroom with shower gel/shampoo/soap - was very impressed to find air-conditioning. Worth asking before arrival if you could have a room on the higher floors with a view of the Olympic Stadium (I can't remember which side of the hotel looks out where...). There's a nice bar, and a restaurant serving well-priced food - we didn't eat in the evenings so can't comment on the quality, however downstairs in the Westfield centre there are all manner of restaurants, fast food takeaways, food courts etc to choose from. Breakfast in the hotel is a good option, certainly for Sundays, as the shopping centre doesnt open til 11am, and there didnt look to be many cafes open earlier. It's £7.99 for a buffet, with 2 kids per adult eating free. Good value. Nice safe area, lots of security around til late, and no need to wander the streets unless you chose to. Doesn't look like the sort of Premier Inn that's going to attract the stag/hen night crowd so potentially quiet at night... it was last weekend anyway! The hotel really is fantastically served by train/tube - you can get the Jubilee Line direct to the O2, Greenwich, Embankment/Westminster, Green Park for Buckingham Palace - Central Line takes you to Oxford Street etc. Our kids loved the driverless DLR which takes you to Tower Hill/Bank, or down through Canary Wharf to Greenwich. My recommendation for a different route to the centre would be get the DLR to the O2, then get the Thames Clipper river bus to Tower Pier or the London Eye pier. Don't be put off by this being a bit out of the centre, this is still an excellent base for a visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Newly open and impressive”
Reviews.Author: Mike48
Reviews.Content: I have to take my hat off to Premier Inn (I was a fan already). I stayed here on only their second night since opening and it was more or less faultless. Add a location only yards away from the biggest shopping mall in London (or is it England or Europe - papers can't decide) with views over the emerging Olympic Park and you can't ask for much more. Stratford is close to the centre of London and Canary Wharf and the price was good

HotelInfo.Name: Premier Inn London Stratford
HotelInfo.Address: 9 International Square, Westfield Stratford City, Montfichet Road, Olympic Park, London E20 1EE, England
